about_the_game:
Find us here:
Official QQ Group: 580628484



Welcome to "Coral Reef Paradise"!
Greetings! I'm John Mill, the warden of Coral Reef. I could give you a detailed introduction to the game, but honestly, why not just dive in and experience it yourself? Saves us both some time, and after all, my time is quite valuable.




It's strange, isn't it? Despite the abundance of modern society, people like you still end up here. Not that it bothers me. I've heard you're claiming to be innocent, though? Classic. Try as you might, no one gets out of this place without my say-so.





So, what’s your approach—words or fists? In Coral Reef Prison, there are two ways to resolve conflicts: through persuasion or... convince them with violence. Choose wisely.




Even in prison, work needs to be done. Whether it’s mining, reading, martial arts, or working the sewing machine, there’s plenty to keep you busy. I’m a man of my word, so work hard, and you’ll get paid. A prosperous life here isn’t just a fantasy. Develop your skills, and if you’re lucky, you might even stand out in Coral Reef Paradise’s unique “reality show.”




Everyone in Coral Reef Prison has a story and a talent. Some might become allies, while others could be a threat. Choose your friends wisely—your decisions will shape your future here. Focus on collaboration for efficiency, and avoid letting your mind wander where it shouldn’t.

Now, I’ll hand it over to the Vinland Studio team. Frankly, they owe me for this promo, but instead, they paid Steam for the interface. Not the best business strategy, if you ask me...

About Vinland Studio


Hello, everyone! We want to express our heartfelt thanks for your support of Prison Notes. Vinland Studio is a small team based in Shanghai. Prison Notes is our first collaborative game, and we hope it brings you an enjoyable experience. We sincerely appreciate you playing our game.

Credits
Producer/Scriptwriter/Director/Game Designer/Music: Pigeon Yusha Chugging Vodka
Art: Digitizer Man
Programmer: GG
Game Designer/Publisher: Leo

Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10 or higher
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 2.00 GHz or AMD A10
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel® HD Graphics 3000
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 5 GB available space

short_description: Prison Notes is a RPG with text-based ADV and cultivation elements. You act as a young migrant worker, wrongly imprisoned in the prison known as "The Coral Reef".What challenges and adventures are awaiting? Will you finally find a way out? Your choices and actions will decide the end of your story.
